BiblioData.Title: NANOTUBE DEVICE
BiblioData.Abstract: A device comprises a nanotube source electrode located on a surface of a substrate between nanotube gate and nanotube drain electrodes.

Claims.P: 1. A device comprising a nanotube source electrode located on a surface of a substrate between nanotube gate and nanotube drain electrodes.
2. A device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the source electrode comprises one or more nanotubes extending generally perpendicularly to the surface of the substrate.
3. A device as claimed in claim 1 or claim 2, wherein the source electrode comprises an array of plural nanotubes.
4. A device as claimed in claim 3, wherein the array is a one dimensional array.
5. A device as claimed in any preceding claim, wherein the nanotubes of the gate and drain electrodes extend generally perpendicularly to the surface of the substrate.
6. A device as claimed in claim 5, wherein each of the gate and drain electrodes comprises an array of plural nanotubes.
7. A device as claimed in any preceding claim, wherein some or all of the nanotubes are electroplated.
8. A filter comprising a device as claimed in any preceding claim.
9. A radio frequency tunable<'> filter comprising a device as claimed in any of claims 1 to 8.
10. A voltage controlled oscillator comprising a device as claimed in any of claims 1 to 8.

11. A method of making a device, the method comprising: providing a substrate; providing gate, source and drain electrodes on the substrate, the source electrode being located between the gate and drain electrodes; and providing each of the source, gate and drain electrodes with one or more nanotubes.
12. A method as claimed in claim 11, wherein providing the nanotubes comprises seeding the electrode with a catalyst.
13. A method as claimed in claim 12, wherein providing the nanotubes comprises growing the nanotubes using chemical vapour deposition.
14. A method as claimed in any of claims 10 to 13, comprising electroplating the nanotubes of the gate and drain electrodes.
